thread.title: James Beard dinner teams five top chefs
thread.title_full: James Beard dinner teams five top chefs

author: Syd Kearney
title: James Beard dinner teams five top chefs
text:
Chef Maurizio Ferrarese at Quattro. Chef Maurizio Ferrarese at Quattro. Photo: Karen Warren, Staff Chef Maurizio Ferrarese's Pannetone Tiramisu dessert. Chef Maurizio Ferrarese's Pannetone Tiramisu dessert. Photo: Karen Warren, Staff Hugo Ortega of Caracol, Backstreet Cafe and Hugo's. Hugo Ortega of Caracol, Backstreet Cafe and Hugo's. Photo: Jon Shapley, Houston Chronicle Image 4 of 9 Chef Hugo Ortega's signature guacamole. Chef Hugo Ortega's signature guacamole. Photo: Paula Murphy Robert Del Grande of RDG + Bar Annie Robert Del Grande of RDG + Bar Annie Photo: Karen Warren, Houston Chronicle Image 6 of 9 Robert Del Grande's barbacoa of Gulf crab and white hominy. Robert Del Grande's barbacoa of Gulf crab and white hominy. Photo: Johnny Hanson Kata Robata executive chef Manabu "Hori" Horiuchi. Kata Robata executive chef Manabu "Hori" Horiuchi. Photo: Nick De La Torre Image 8 of 9 Horiuchi's Kinmedai, Big Eye Tuna Ceviche, Shiso Leche de Tigre, and mango puree. Horiuchi's Kinmedai, Big Eye Tuna Ceviche, Shiso Leche de Tigre, and mango puree. Photo: Nick De La Torre Image 9 of 9 James Beard dinner teams five top chefs 1 / 9 Back to Gallery 
Five of Houston’s best chefs will come together at Quattro of a special culinary evening. 
The James Beard Celebrity Chef Tour Dinner will include courses (with pairings) by Robert Del Grande of RDG + Bar Annie , Quattro’s Maurizio Ferrarese , Manabu Horiuchi of Kata Robata , Caracol ’s Hugo Ortega and Marie LeNotre of Culinary Institute LeNotre . 
The dinner will begin at 6:30 p.m. Nov. 21 with a reception and conclude with an after-party in the Lobby Lounge of the Four Seasons Hotel, 1300 Lamar. Quattro is located on the downtown hotel’s third floor.
